channel.title: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
channel.description:
Hi, Anyone know how I can change the text at the top left of the screen. Show here as I hover my mouse over the cook's assistant line (Retexted to community forums)
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/1072jvd.png[/img]
Any help is appreciated!

item.title: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

corner text is handled in the cache but most refactored clients have it hardcoded in the client.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!

item.title: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
item.dc:creator: @iBucky iBucky
item.description:
@iBucky wrote:

I edited the tooltip. I can change the tab wording to anything and the corner text will stay the same.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!

item.title: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay, bucky, are you using 1 or 2 strings in a command, and did you actually do it, or did you follow a tutorial?
Gz anyways.
I’d use something similar:

public void sendFrame127(String buttonText, string cornerText){
//code
}

Unless you just went client sided and just made the variable for the text in the corner the same as the variable for the button text, which is not the best idea if the text is really long…

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!

item.title: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Did you edit it server sided?

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!

item.title: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
item.dc:creator: @iBucky iBucky
item.description:
@iBucky wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:529251”][quote author=iBucky link=topic=648007.msg4358548#msg4358548 date=1378182734]

This is normally done client sided… There isn’t a method created (right now) to edit that specifically…

I need to create the method? Im going to guess I add it into RSInterface.Java?

Hahaha yeah, good luck creating that method. You’d need to send a packet from the server to the client. Have the client read the packet and update the text.

So its not possible?
[/quote]
It isn’t that it is not possible. I just honestly don’t see you doing it.[/quote]

Cool, Well I figured it out.
Don’t under estimate anybody.

2iu6r61.png771×557

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Changing Text at top left screen!
